Posted By: bowlofgumbo (11/13/2011 6:24:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.  
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.   
  
I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal) is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)
posts.html:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.

I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a Lotus Petal is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)

Posted By: TamiYamiyo (6/27/2012 11:13:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I do not own this card but i know someone who does and he also has a phage the untouchable and like tons of other cards. So when he said Phage the Untouchable was a shit card i went on and convinced him to lend it to me so we could play a game of Magic. We went on to play 3 games and he used a deck that consists of poison counters. On the second game after losing the first one i draw my hand and i got Black Lotus, Phage the Untouchable, A Swamp, Cabal Ritual x2, Deathgrip and Execute. I remember this hand perfectly because i won the game in 2 turns. He has these really old and nasty cards like tolarian academy and yawgmoth’s will. I never even thought of that combination till i pulled this hand it really takes four cards and extreme luck to win the game!
